result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Skylar Lee Bardell

8:49 AM Defendant Skylar Lee Bardell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has contacted 3 attorneys but cannot afford and files petition for court appointed counsel. Court orally examines defendant's financials and will not appoint counsel. Court will adjourn for defendant to secure counsel. Court continues to find good cause to extend time limits. State advises the court that the Victim is present in court and would like to address the court regarding the no contact order. Court informs a written request should be filed with the court prior to the hearing date/time. Court will hear victim on request. Request made by victim. Court denies request to modify bail conditions.
Status hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status hearing on October 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.

from T.B. re: request for dismissal. Forwarded to Clerk DA for review.

*EX-PARTE COMMUNICATION FILED BY A NON-CASE PARTY. NOT READ BY THE COURT.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No contact with T.L.B. No contact with  523 E.  Schowalter Street, Port Washington WI. Provide the court with any updated address.

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Skylar Lee Bardell appeared by video, in custody of OZSD. Atty Heather Dvoran appears as a friend of the court. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Reading of complaint waived. Court finds probable cause. State requests $2500 cash bail with conditions. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for defendant to hire counsel. Court advises defendant to use a third party for making any arrangements regarding his children.
Status hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
